result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin J Wagnitz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kevin J Wagnitz in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Kevin J Wagnitz in custody.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:51 AM. Also called 14CF121. Court has plea questionnaire, looks like defendant is pleading G to all counts as alleged on 14CF137 and State will be moving to dismiss 14CF121 in its entirety. Burns and Wagnitz agree. State moves to dismiss repeater allegations on counts #2 and #3. Court dismisses and reads in 14CF121 and dismisses the repeater allegation on counts #2 and #3, goes thru plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends #2 - court costs only; recommends on count #1 - 6 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES - consecutive to any sentence he is currently serving, $500 fine plus costs and surcharges; #3 - 6 years in the WI State Prison System consissting of 3 years on initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES, concurrent to count #1. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends a 6 month prison sentence - concurrent with probation and payment of fines to commence 60 days after release from incarceration, ask that he be found eligible for earned release. Wagnitz makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: conditions of ES are: maintain absolute sobriety, any program felt logical by P&P, # 2- costs only, $500 fine plus costs on #2 and #3 - count #1 - 2.5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 2 years of initial confinement followed by 6 months of ES - consecutive to current sentence; #3 - 2.5 years in WI State Prison System consisting of 2 years of initial confinement followed by 6 months  - concurrent to count #2, right to appeal, no voting rights, no possession of firearms, adjourned.

Case not called only doing scheduling for jury trial date. 14CF121 should be scheduled 1st for jury trial date. 9/15/15 jury date for 14CF121 and on 14CF137 believe that case will settle and should be set for FPT on 8/25/15 @ 1 pm. Adjourned

Defendant Kevin J Wagnitz in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Kevin J Wagnitz in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also called 14CF137. Called at 1:16 PM. State - here for ARGN on both cases. Burns has Inforamtions for both cases, waives reading of them, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, sets both matters for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: of Judge - copy given to JA

Called at 3:00 PM. Kevin Wagnitz appears in person and with counsel Mary Burns. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. State calls Deputy Chris Tanner. Tanner sworn in at 3:00 PM. Direct exam by State. Burns objects - speculation - re-stated. Burns objects - hearsay - accept objection for the record but overruled at this point (3:06 PM). Cross exam by Burns at 3:12 PM. Tanner excused at 3:15 PM. State calls Deputy Collette. Collette sworn in at 3:15 PM. Direct exam by State. Cross exam by Burns at 3:21 PM. Re-direct by State at 3:27 PM. Re-cross by Burns at 3:29 PM. Re-direct by State at 3:29 PM. State recalls Deputy Tanner. Re-direct by State at 3:30 PM. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (3:32 PM). Cross exam by Burns at 3:33 PM. Tanner excused at 3:36 PM. State calls Samantha Smith. Smith sworn in at 3:37 PM. Cross exam by Burns at 3:42 PM. Re-direct by State at 3:45 PM. Smith excused at 3:46 PM. State makes statement - asks Court to find probable cause. Burns makes argument - does not believe State met its burden. Court finds probable that a felony was committed, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors complaint. Burns has Information, requests ARGN date. Court continues bond, set for ARGN on 1/7/15 at 9:30 AM.
Preliminary hearing on December 11, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Kevin J Wagnitz in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:17 am. Has complaint, waive reading, request PH, waive time limits. Court waives time limits. State asks for no operation of any motor vehicles, ATV, UTV, $2000 sig bond.  Court sets bond at $650 with no operation of any motor vehicle.Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 11, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
